p: Fifty-nine mothers of the 130 (45.4%) infants with RSV infection also had a respiratory illness within 1 week of the infant’s illness. Samples for RSV testing were available for 47 (79.7%) of these mothers, among whom RSV was detected in 29.8% (n = 14; 12 HIV-uninfected and 2 HIV-infected) of illnesses. This included 11 episodes in which RSV was detected on the same day in the mother–infant pair and 3 first in the infant (3–7 days before maternal detection).
